ca.forklabs.javaxpcom

Class Crawler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.forklabs.javaxpcom.Crawler

  • public abstract class Crawler
extends Object
    Class Crawler provides a skeleton to build web crawlers using Mozilla and SWT.

    This crawler gives access to a Browser object inside a simple Shell that can be interacted with to navigate the web and access the underlying nsIDOMDocument.

    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Daniel LÃ©onard

        protected void countDownLatch()

      • waitOnLatch

        protected boolean waitOnLatch(long timeout,
                  TimeUnit unit)
                       throws InterruptedException
        Makes the current thread wait on the latch.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if the count reached zero, false if the waiting time elapsed before the count reached zero.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted when waiting on the latch.
        See Also:
        CountDownLatch.await(long, TimeUnit)

      • waitForPageToLoad

        protected void waitForPageToLoad()
                          throws IOException
        Blocks the thread until the web page has been loaded.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the web page fails to load before the timeout expires.

      • configureNewShell

        protected void configureNewShell(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
        Configures the newly created shell. This implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        shell - the new shell.

      • configureNewBrowser

        protected void configureNewBrowser(org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser browser)
        Configures the newly created browser. This implementation does nothing. When this method is called for the first time, the only configuration that has been done to the browser is to give it the same bounds as the client area of the enclosing shell.
        Parameters:
        browser - the new browser.
